text: you know I've been thinking about what's
art and I believe one interpretation of
art pop could be that art has become a
vehicle that people embrace and more
their daily life today more people are
interested in art engaged with art and
it's actually about taking that
engagement and seeing how that's kind of
reflected in the world around you the
first time I ever met Gaga was probably
about three years ago she performed at
the Metropolitan Museum at one of the
fashion balls and after her performance
she gave me a big hug and she said you
know Jeff I used to hang out in Central
Park when I was just a teenager and I
talked to my friends about your work and
you're my hero and to hear such
flattering words from her I was really
in the spring of this year I received a
call from the close friend of Gaga's and
said that you know Gaga would like you
to be involved with her new art pop
album designing the cover Gaga told me
that she wanted to be a sculpture so I
asked her to come and do a photoshoot
together and she came and we shot
different photographs and I looked at
what I thought was sculptural and also
could be an image that wouldn't work
well for the cover at the art rave I'm
really excited to show five sculptures
the sculpture of Gaga's really the
centerpiece sculpture and it's the
largest of the pieces she's a hundred
inches tall but she's sitting down so
you can imagine how massive she she is
with a very large blue gazing ball
that's between her legs as on the the
cover of the album

in art there's this concept that art is
not finished until it's interpreted by
the viewer so to have the opportunity of
somebody like Gaga to want to

the ability just to touch the life even
if it's just one person out of the

I mean Gaga could be singing about
